questions.claim: The government has officially passed a nationwide law that requires every social media profile to publicly display the user's real name.
questions.explanation: This is a common misinterpretation. Proposals discussed in some regions refer to real-name verification on the backend, not mandatory public display for all users.

questions.claim: A presidential candidate promised to eliminate all personal income taxes during a debate.
questions.explanation: The widely shared clip was edited. The original statement described targeted deductions/credits for specific brackets rather than abolishing all income taxes.

questions.claim: Ballots from a recent election were found in large numbers inside a river and were counted anyway.
questions.explanation: Authorities reported isolated incidents of damaged mail, but those ballots were voided and not counted. The 'river' claim lacks credible sourcing.

questions.claim: Drinking lemon water can dissolve kidney stones and replace medical treatment.
questions.explanation: Hydration is helpful, but lemon water does not replace diagnosis or evidence-based treatment. Delaying care can increase risk.

questions.claim: High-dose vitamin C reliably and significantly shortens the common cold for most people.
questions.explanation: Evidence does not support a large, consistent effect. Benefits, if any, are modest and inconsistent across studies.

questions.claim: Essential oils can cure bacterial infections without antibiotics.
questions.explanation: Some lab studies show limited effects, but clinical evidence is insufficient. For bacterial infections, follow medical guidance on antibiotics.

questions.claim: AI-generated images can always be spotted by the human eye.
questions.explanation: Visual cues can help, but many AI images are indistinguishable without forensic tools, metadata, or watermarking.

questions.claim: Disabling location permissions means apps cannot track you at all.
questions.explanation: Apps may still infer behavior via network data, device fingerprints, or other signals. Permission controls reduce risk but don't guarantee anonymity.

questions.claim: A single viral post can permanently 'boost' an account so every future post goes viral.
questions.explanation: Platform algorithms weigh many signals per post. Past success doesn't guarantee future reach without ongoing engagement and quality.
